page.title: 13Local history
page.content: The Manor of Deene originally belonged to the Abbey of Westminster...with the monks using the area for hunting. Then in 1215 Deene was leased to Sir Ivo de Deene, whose family continued to live there until the late 15th century. Other families,including the Colets & Lyttons,held the property until it was acquired by Sir Robert Brudenell in 1514.Deene Hall has remained in the Brudenell family to the present day. The villages of Deene and Deenethorpe have been closely associated with Deene Estate....most of the inhabitants being employed there. The 16th century saw the building of Kirby Hall,but this Elizabethan house was not regularly lived in after the 18th century. Much of the study area was ravaged by quarrying in the early 20th century,but has now been reclaimed for farming.
